benchmark_details.name: SEA-BED (Southeast Asia Embedding Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: SEA-BED is the first large-scale SEA embedding benchmark with 169 datasets across 9 tasks and 10 languages, focusing on the evaluation of sentence embeddings for Southeast Asian languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and improve sentence embedding models' performance across Southeast Asian languages, addressing the challenges specific to low-resource languages.

data.source: Various datasets curated specifically for SEA languages, primarily created by native speakers.
data.format: Various formats including, but not limited to, JSON and CSV.
data.annotation: Annotated primarily by native speakers or through expert curation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated comparably across different tasks, using standard evaluation strategies.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in the given tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Results show substantial shifts in model rankings when evaluated against previous benchmark settings, particularly MMTEB.
methodology.validation: Through testing 17 embedding models across 6 studies.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: An explicit analysis of linguistic groups within Southeast Asia to ensure equitable representation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Datasets are curated to avoid sensitive data and ensure participant anonymity.
